channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 3月にサッカー関係者への放映権料の賄賂で有罪となったFOXの元幹部エルナン・ロペスの有罪判決を破棄した米判事（Ronald Blum/Associated Press）
item.description:
Ronald Blum / Associated Press:
A US judge throws out the convictions of former Fox executive Hernan Lopez, who was found guilty in March of bribing soccer officials for broadcasting rights  —  A federal judge threw out the convictions of a former Fox executive and a South American sports media and marketing company …

item.title: CNNの新CEOでBBCとNYTのベテランであるマーク・トンプソンのプロフィールを紹介。
item.description:
Clare Malone / New Yorker:
A profile of Mark Thompson, CNN's new CEO and a veteran of BBC and NYT, as Dean Baquet says his hiring indicates a strategy that goes beyond making job cuts  —  After a turbulent year under new ownership, the cable news network is hoping that Mark Thompson, a veteran of the Times and the BBC, can turn things around.

item.title: スカイ・ニュースのキャスター、ソフィー・リッジとトレバー・フィリップスとの新番組、英国の政治ジャーナリズムの現状、スカイの「政治への大きな投資」などについてのQ&A（ブロン・マハー／プレス・ガジェット紙）
item.description:
Bron Maher / Press Gazette:
Q&A with Sky News anchors Sophy Ridge and Trevor Phillips on their new shows, the state of UK political journalism, Sky's “big investment in politics”, and more  —  Ridge's Politics Hub will focus on the “daily machinations”, while Phillips on Sundays will go deeper.

item.title: 経済的ダメージが拡大するなか、WGAとSAG-AFTRAのストライキを長引かせているのは何か：賃金格差への怒り、組合の結束、仕事の将来への不安（Meg James/Los Angeles Times）
item.description:
Meg James / Los Angeles Times:
A look at what's prolonging the WGA and SAG-AFTRA strikes as the economic damage grows: anger over pay disparities, union cohesion, and future of work worries  —  Jobs, Labor & Workplace  —  Hollywood had hoped its summer of strikes would end by Labor Day, but ongoing talks between the unions …

item.title: Gizmodo en Españolのライターによると、ギズモードのオーナーであるG/O Mediaはスペイン語サイトの編集者を閉鎖・解雇し、現在はAIを使って記事を翻訳しているという（Emilia David/The Verge）。
item.description:
Emilia David / The Verge:
A Gizmodo en Español writer says Gizmodo owner G/O Media shut down and laid off editors of the Spanish-language site, and is now using AI to translate articles  —  Gizmodo owner G/O Media shut down and laid off editors of its Spanish-language site Gizmodo en Español and is now using AI to translate articles.

item.title: ロシア当局は、ノーベル平和賞受賞者でノバヤ・ガゼータのEICであるドミトリー・ムラトフを、クレムリンに対する批判者を弾圧するために使用される外国の諜報員であると宣言した（AP通信）。
item.description:
Associated Press:
Russian authorities declare Nobel Peace Prize winner and Novaya Gazeta EIC Dmitry Muratov to be a foreign agent, a label used to suppress critics of the Kremlin  —  Russian authorities on Friday declared newspaper editor Dmitry Muratov, a winner of the Nobel Peace Prize, to be a foreign agent …

item.title: SAG-AFTRAの全国理事会は、ビデオゲーム会社との今後の交渉に備え、ストライキ承認投票を組合員に送ることを全会一致で決議した（David Robb/Deadline）
item.description:
David Robb / Deadline:
SAG-AFTRA's National Board votes unanimously to send a strike authorization vote to its members in preparation of upcoming negotiations with video game firms  —  SAG-AFTRA, which has been on strike against film and scripted TV productions since July 14, is now gearing up for another possible strike …

item.title: PragerU Kidsに関するMedia Matters for Americaのレポート：Metaは「社会問題、選挙、政治」にまつわる広告の透明性ルールを一貫して実施していない（Vittoria Elliott/Wired）
item.description:
Vittoria Elliott / Wired:
A Media Matters for America report on PragerU Kids: Meta isn't consistently enforcing transparency rules for ads around “social issues, elections, or politics”  —  A nonprofit watchdog group has found that the right-wing group PragerU has pushed out more than 100 political ads …

item.title: ガーディアンは、ブルームバーグ、ニューヨーク・タイムズ、ワシントン・ポスト、ロイター、CNNを含む他の出版社とともに、OpenAIのGPTBotウェブクローラーをブロックしている（Dan Milmo/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Dan Milmo / The Guardian:
The Guardian joins other publishers, including Bloomberg, The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, and CNN, in blocking OpenAI's GPTBot web crawler  —  Publisher is latest news organisation to block the artificial intelligence company from harvesting content to create its tools

item.title: 米BLSの2023年8月雇用統計によると、映画・テレビ・音楽業界は「ストライキを反映して」17,000人の雇用が減少、その他の業界は雇用が増加（Alex Weprin/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Alex Weprin / The Hollywood Reporter:
The US BLS August 2023 employment report shows the film, TV, and music industries shed 17,000 jobs, “reflecting strike activity”; other sectors saw job growth  —  The U.S. government's Bureau of Labor Statistics released the number in its August employment report.

item.title: カナダ、ビッグ・テックの法案C-18への懸念に対処、グーグルとメタはパブリッシャーに年間1億2660万ドルと4400万ドルを支払うと発表。
item.description:
Reuters:
Canada tries to address Big Tech's Bill C-18 concerns, saying Google and Meta would pay publishers ~$126.6M and ~$44M per year; Meta plans to keep blocking news  —  Canada unveiled draft rules on Friday for a law to compel internet giants to pay news outlets, saying it was addressing …

item.title: 情報筋MetaがEU圏のユーザー向けにFacebookとInstagramの有料広告フリー版を検討中、プライバシーに関する懸念とEU規制当局からの監視をかわすため（New York Times）
item.description:
New York Times:
Sources: Meta is considering paid, ad-free versions of Facebook and Instagram for users in the EU, to fend off privacy concerns and scrutiny from EU regulators  —  The subscription plan is a response to European Union policies and court rulings to restrict Meta's data-collection practices.

item.title: Charterは、ディズニーとの係争は「典型的なキャリッジ紛争ではない」とし、もし取引が成立しなければ、ケーブル会社はビデオ事業から「移行」する用意があると述べている（Alex Weprin/Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Alex Weprin / Hollywood Reporter:
Charter says its Disney dispute “is not a typical carriage dispute”, and the cable company is prepared to “move on” from its video business if no deal is made  —  The cable giant, with nearly 15 million TV subs, told analysts Friday that it is prepared to “move on” …

item.title: 2022年10月に入社したアンバー・デ・ボットン英首相広報部長が退社、デ・ボットン氏は以前ITVニュースの英国ニュース部長だった（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
Amber de Botton, the UK prime minister's director of communications, leaves, after joining in October 2022; de Botton was previously ITV News' head of UK news  —  Amber de Botton was the second ITV News journalist to be snapped up by Rishi Sunak.  —  Update 1 September 2023 …

item.title: 英地方出版社ナショナル・ワールドの記者約248人が給与問題でストライキを決行、NUJは4月1日に遡る4.5％の賃上げ提案を拒否（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
Around 248 journalists at UK regional publisher National World vote to strike over a pay dispute; the NUJ rejected a 4.5% pay raise offer backdated to April 1  —  Some 78% of 248 journalists said they would be prepared to strike.  —  Journalists at National World have voted to take strike action …
